messageBody:
When I asked a likewise question the answer was that we are only testing our own interfaces. Therefore, you are not testing that the connection to the database or the that the database actually works - we assume they do because they are out of our scope. This of course assumes you are not writing your own JDBC driver.

I was pointed to using mock objects and the like; however what I ended up doing is using setup to run scripts that put specific information into the database to test conditions that I wanted - in essence juicing the data to test the handling of that data under a limited number of conditions.


Chip

Subject: [junit] JUnit, Ant and databases


Hi,

what is the best way to verify database updates in the db? I really do not
want to write jdbc code in the the JUnit cases if i can avoid it.

We got round the issue of running specific sql scripts in the
setUp()/tearDown() methods by calling Ant programmatically with a buildfile
containing the required code. Works really well and means we can use Ant
functionality in our test cases.

Thanks

Rakesh
